alert.note: Alert for Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:29PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Oxford and east central Carroll Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Conway, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conway, Fryeburg, Hiram, Madison, Brownfield, Freedom, Denmark, Eaton and Porter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
